question_text: How does double data rate (DDR) memory improve over single data rate (SDR) memory technologies?
answer_options: It uses ECC to prevent parity errors.
It enables memory to retain data after power loss.
It allows data transfers on both rising and falling clock edges.
It synchronizes memory and CPU using independent clocks.
correct_answer: It allows data transfers on both rising and falling clock edges.
explanation: DDR memory effectively doubles the data transfer rate by performing read/write operations on both edges of each clock cycle.
